meanings.definition: Insufficient for the demand or requirement
meanings.sent1: Food was scarce during the drought.
meanings.sent2: Water became scarce in the desert.
meanings.sent3: The picnic felt scarce without any sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was as scarce as rain in a desert.
meanings.sent5: The treasure was hidden in a scarce cave.

meanings.sent1: Toys were scarce at the yard sale.
meanings.sent2: Birds were scarce in the winter forest.
meanings.sent3: The party felt scarce without any music.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as scarce as snow in summer.
meanings.sent5: The stars were scarce in the cloudy sky.

meanings.sent1: Rare books are scarce in this library.
meanings.sent2: Fresh fruits were scarce in the snowy village.
meanings.sent3: His jokes were scarce during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as scarce as a shooting star.
meanings.sent5: The key was scarce in the dark room.
